Name: Outer coffin of Pasa (Hetep-Amun)
Description: The wooden coffin is covered with plaster and painted. The chest is decorated with an ornate collar. Underneath follow registers with representations of gods and columns of text with offering prayers. The wig is decorated with a fillet. On the bottom of the inside of the coffin, Horus is depicted on a standard, the side walls depict the goddesses Isis and Nephthys. At the head end is the sign for the horizon. The deceased is here called Pasa, but his full name is Hetep-Amun. This outer coffin forms a set with an inner coffin, which is also kept in the Vienna museum (Ã„OS 219).
